alert.note: Alert for Franklin; Lawrence (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 09 at 8:33PM CST by NWS Huntsville
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTHEASTERN FRANKLIN AND SOUTHERN LAWRENCE COUNTIES THROUGH 915 PM CST... At 833 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Haleyville, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 40-50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Moulton, Speake, Bankhead National Forest, Wren, and Landersville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM CST for north central and northwestern Alabama. A Tornado Watch also remains in effect until 200 AM CST for north central Alabama.
